item.title: Clive Thompson
item.description: Remember all the right wing folks were fulminating about collusion between social media and the government?you know, the horrors of the "twitter files"?how it's *incredibly dangerous* for social-media executives to be in close communication with the federal government?the primrose path to censorship, and all that?As @mmasnick notes, these folks are all *quite* silent about Musk being *completely in bed with the incoming Trump administration* https://www.msnbc.com/opinion/msnbc-opinion/trump-musk-partnership-x-twitter-files-rcna180427a *banger* of a piece

item.title: CosmicRami
item.description: It's #Pulsar confirmation day!Then PhD student, Jocelyn Bell Burnell, actually detected the first signals from a pulsar on 6 Aug '67. From those results, Queen JBB connected the dots, this was astrophysical!But after this first detection in Aug, there was nothing.Until Nov 28.Bell Burnell didn't give up in the meantime. She kept searching for the pulsar, and it was through her hard work, dedication, and persistence that the 28 Nov. confirmation came in.The 'little bits of scruff' returned! Astrophysics changed forever.Read more: https://www.spaceaustralia.com/feature/55-years-pulsar-scienceUnfortunately, she never received the Nobel Prize for this. A huge scar on the awards, to this day. üì∏ CSIROpedia#Astrodon #RadioAstronomy #Astrophysics

item.title: Mike Gerdts
item.description: So #nbc just aired a story on #whoopingCough and asked why it is becoming more common without providing an answer. Neither the reporters nor anyone they talked to about it thought to mention a vaccine is available and vaccination rates are declining. Of course they also made no mention that it is up from a recent historic low in a time of people being vigilant about spreading respiratory viruses.

item.title: Brandon Stell
item.description: Spread the word.PubPeer is awarding $1,000 for outstanding comments. Comments featured on the front page (pubpeer.com) are strong contenders.https://fediscience.org/@PubPeer@mastodon.social/113548315559814255

item.title: Tom Stafford
item.description: TODAY: Declining a journal review because the authors write "data is available upon reasonable request"Shown: my email to the editorFeels bad and good at the same timeWhatever happened to opennessinitiative.org anyway?#OpenResearch

item.title: d a t green
item.description: Can you find this book from my childhood, from late 70s-early 80s?Paperback, from those "book club" catalogues that UK schools used to get.Seasonal stories, aimed at children.(Sub-)title was something like "From Michaelmas to Candlemas".One story was about need to take Christmas decorations down by Candlemas, else goblins will use them to hide behind. Based on Herrick poem: https://www.luminarium.org/sevenlit/herrick/candlemas1.htmI have googled so hard, but I have failed.If you can find, I would be most grateful.

item.title: Mastodon Migration
item.description:
üî• Introducing Follow Packs üî• So, maybe you've heard about Bluesky's popular 'Starter Packs'. BS users can create lists of accounts others can follow with one-click.Well, we don't have this capability, but here is a way to follow entire lists of accounts. Not quite as convenient ü§∑, but you can import packs of accounts, and you can add them directly into lists! üëÄ ***Update 11/29: New CYBERSECURITY and LEGAL packs!***read on...1/3
#FollowPack #StarterPack
